Is on black oak and hickory soil, in high state

This WATEnISG PLACE is finely situated IN
the high and healthy country, five miles west OF
Wilmington, commanding an extensive view of
the surrounding country, the River Delaware and
the neghboring States. The grounds OF the
company afford pleasant and shady promenades,
and are bounded by fine streams,


The virtues Of the Waters are those OF the pur-
est Chalybeat according to the analysis or Pro
fessor Keating, of Philadelphia They have been
particularly eiiicacous in bilious and other fe-
vers, and are celebrated as fine tonic.


The vicinity to Wilmington, offers at all times,
access to an excellent markets and the daily in
tercourse by Steam Boat lines between that
place and Newcastle, to and from Philadelphia
and Baltimore, affords facility Of comnlHnlca-
ton not possessed by any other watching Place

ant and saluhrious Retreat.

A friend has translated the following ad-
yertisemen, from late Havana paper. It
illustrates the taste of the Spaniards for
those disgracefuI scenes Of brutal sport, to
which the nation have SO long been addict
ed.


BULL FIGHT.


"On Monday, the 11th inst at S O'Clock
in the evening, weather permitting, the 28th
fight will take place; at which, Senior Don
Rafael Rodriguez, Lieutenant Governor
and FIRST Assessor General of the Govern
inent of His Majesty, (whom God preserve)
will preside.


"The course will comprise seven bulls to
be killed, which will first be fought with
pixies and barbed-arrows, and, besides, by
four men with the cloak, and not by anna
teu,s, ia consequence of decree OF his
ExcelIcncy the Governor and Captain Cen
'eral; and the sport will be of excellent and
extraordinary merit, as well Ss for the par
ecular care which has bern taken in Sc
iecting bulls Of the moss bravery and feroci-
~, as also in the great interests of the ma
address, pcadorcs and banderilleros, by
whom the public will be perfectly gratlfied
and to which will contribute the amateur,
pribunc, y'o viii barb them during the
whole nght; and also the matadores, who
viii also barb the ones seyerally assigned
shem.


"Rafaei Rebullo will use the first sword,
who offers the greatest powers to use 1t to
che satisfaction Of the public; and new pi-
cadore will GENE in the class Of an amateur,
who will change with Joaquin Zapata--both
of whom will fulfil their duties with their
best intelligence and ability.


The subscriptions will be opened to such
as may wish to enter their names tor any
class OF seats, and the general entry will be
annsunced as at the preyious fights The
.ioors vii, be open on the day of the per-
gormance, at half past two p. nj. for the bet
Ger accommodation of the public. The price
viii 5e the same as at the previous fights"

full articles.article:
In justice to myself, have been induced to
reply to false and unjustifable attack made
upon me and others by swain, the vender of a
certain Panacea in this city | do thisaso, in Or
der to remove from the public mind, the false
impressions which may arise out of his pompous
and incorrect statement in the public prints


Mr. Swain wishes to establish the belief, that he
is the sole patentee of the celebrated Panacea,
upon which he has built his fortues; and not sat-

full articles.headline: Borough Aoan,
full articles.article:
THE undersigned having been appointed by
the Borough Council a Committe to receive Pro-
posals for a Loan not exceeding $4,000 Dollars,
on the credit of the borough of Wilmington,
for the purpose Of supplying the Borough with
water, at a rate of interest not exceeding hive
per ccntu,n per annum, payable seIni-annually,
and reimbursabe at the end of 20 years from the
4th of July, 1827-Notice is therefore hereby
given, that such proposals will now be received
by the undersigned at any time after the present
date, for taking said Loan.


JAMES BROBS0N,


JAMES GARDNER,


JOSEPH GRUBB,


WIN. LARKiN,


Committee.
June 10Th. 1897. S9--tf

full articles.headline: A Valuable Farm for Sale.
full articles.article:
RxA rs offered fov private sale,a paf1d-
..ss:s# Il bic Farm, situated IN Pencader
hsss hundred, Newcastle County, Del a.
sebout mile south ofkewark; adJoln-
ing lands of F. II. FIoltzbecker, the heirs OF VII
liam Lindsey, dec, Zacharish Jones, and Others
containing 106 acres, "more or less his Farm
Is on black oak and hickory soil, in high state
Of cultivation, and equaled by few IN the neigh
bourhood; ;--it is well adapted to all kinds OF
Grasses and Grain;---has on it a young thriving
orchard of about one hundred trees ol choice
fruit; an excellent bottom meadow, through
which runs never failing stream; and seven I'll
iages or fields, all under good fence. The I'M
provements two story log dwelling house,
we'll weather-boarded outside and lathed and
plastered inside, having three rooms down and
sour up stairs, with first rate cellar under the
whole.--Also, kitchen adjoining, with pump
Of excellent water at the door; stone milk
house and smoke house; frame barn, nearly
new, with excellent stabling underneath, suth-
cient to hold ten or twelve head of horses be-
sides milch cows, calves, &c. Further descrp.
tion is deemed unnecessary, as it is expected
that any wishing to purchase will view the prem
ises, which the subscriber, living thereon, car
show, and make known the conditions of sale.


JOHN PITNER.


Nav %, 1927. 57-4t

SPRING.
full articles.article:
The spacious and elegant house belonging to
the Company, which was completed last fall, is
now open and handsomely furnished for the re-
ception of visitors and boarders. under the SUI
perinendence of the Subscriber.


This WATEnISG PLACE is finely situated IN
the high and healthy country, five miles west OF
Wilmington, commanding an extensive view of
the surrounding country, the River Delaware and
the neghboring States. The grounds OF the
company afford pleasant and shady promenades,
and are bounded by fine streams,


The virtues Of the Waters are those OF the pur-
est Chalybeat according to the analysis or Pro
fessor Keating, of Philadelphia They have been
particularly eiiicacous in bilious and other fe-
vers, and are celebrated as fine tonic.


The vicinity to Wilmington, offers at all times,
access to an excellent markets and the daily in
tercourse by Steam Boat lines between that
place and Newcastle, to and from Philadelphia
and Baltimore, affords facility Of comnlHnlca-
ton not possessed by any other watching Place


Parties can be accommodated at short notice
with dinners, collations, Ice creams. &c. &c.


No excrtions shall be>spared by the Proprietor,
to CRAFTY every want Of the visitor to tins pleas
ant and saluhrious Retreat.


Charges will be moderate.


CHARLES STANLEY.


!rne !, 1897. 39-5m


n. Il. Carriages gigs or horses n,ty alwa.

roads, to the neighboring towns villages, canal
&r lIorars taken AT livery. g.. :.

A friend has translated the following ad-
yertisemen, from late Havana paper. It
illustrates the taste of the Spaniards for
those disgracefuI scenes Of brutal sport, to
which the nation have SO long been addict
ed.


BULL FIGHT.


"On Monday, the 11th inst at S O'Clock
in the evening, weather permitting, the 28th
fight will take place; at which, Senior Don
Rafael Rodriguez, Lieutenant Governor
and FIRST Assessor General of the Govern
inent of His Majesty, (whom God preserve)
will preside.


"The course will comprise seven bulls to
be killed, which will first be fought with
pixies and barbed-arrows, and, besides, by
four men with the cloak, and not by anna
teu,s, ia consequence of decree OF his
ExcelIcncy the Governor and Captain Cen
'eral; and the sport will be of excellent and
extraordinary merit, as well Ss for the par
ecular care which has bern taken in Sc
iecting bulls Of the moss bravery and feroci-
~, as also in the great interests of the ma
address, pcadorcs and banderilleros, by
whom the public will be perfectly gratlfied
and to which will contribute the amateur,
pribunc, y'o viii barb them during the
whole nght; and also the matadores, who
viii also barb the ones seyerally assigned
shem.


"Rafaei Rebullo will use the first sword,
who offers the greatest powers to use 1t to
che satisfaction Of the public; and new pi-
cadore will GENE in the class Of an amateur,
who will change with Joaquin Zapata--both
of whom will fulfil their duties with their
best intelligence and ability.


The subscriptions will be opened to such
as may wish to enter their names tor any
class OF seats, and the general entry will be
annsunced as at the preyious fights The
.ioors vii, be open on the day of the per-
gormance, at half past two p. nj. for the bet
Ger accommodation of the public. The price
viii 5e the same as at the previous fights"

ence have had of the efficacy OF Parker's Pana-
cca, | am enabled to say, that three patients,
